title: Artichoke Dip
description: A simple and delicious appetizer.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in an oven proof dish.
Bake for 30 minutes in a 350 degree oven.
Serve with crackers.
notes: The beginning is the most important part of the work. - Plato

title: Breakfast Casserole
description: A hearty breakfast dish perfect for feeding a crowd.
ingredients: 10-15 Pieces White Bread - Remove Crust and Cube
1 1/2 lbs. Bacon - Cook, Drain and Crumble
instructions: The night before serving, arrange cubed bread in a 9" x 13" pan.
Mix together the onion, eggs, milk, dry mustard, seasoned pepper, salt, and Worcestershire sauce.
Pour this mixture over the cubed bread.
Next, mix together the crumbled bacon, melted butter/margarine, and crushed cornflakes.
Spread this mixture on top of the bread and egg mixture.
The next day you can bake this at 325 degrees for 1 hour, then let it rest for 15 minutes before serving.
Serves 10-12.
notes: Love and eggs are best when they are fresh.

title: Cherries Ala Emmet
description: A simple cherry appetizer or after-dinner treat.
instructions: Wash cherries and leave stems on.
Pack into small jars.
Put a piece of cinnamon stick and a couple of whole cloves into each jar.
Fill with grappa.
Cover jars tightly and let stand for about a month or more.
Use as appetizer or after dinner treat.
notes: They will knock your socks off!

title: Easy Antipasto
description: A quick and easy Italian appetizer.
instructions: Mix together the Good Seasons Italian Dressing mix, oil, vinegar and dill weed.
Marinate chopped vegetables, adding any other vegetables you desire.
Stir often before serving.
notes: The taste of an olive is older than meat, older than wine. - Lawrence Durrell

title: Liverwurst Ball
description: A savory appetizer perfect for parties.
instructions: Mix together liverwurst, green onion, salt, pepper, thyme, lemon rind, mayonnaise, and melted butter.
Form into ball.
Chill.
Frost with Philadelphia cream cheese which has been thinned.
Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese.
notes: A host is like a general: It takes a mishap to reveal his genius. - Horace

title: Potato Florentine Strata
description: A hearty breakfast or brunch dish.
ingredients: 1 (26 oz.) Pkg. Frozen Country Style Hash Browns- Thawed
1 Cup Onion - Chopped Fine and Divided
3 Cups Finely Shredded Colby and Monterey-Jack Cheese
1 (10 oz.) pkg. Frozen Chopped Spinach - Thawed & Completely Drained
1/2 Cup Marinated sun-Dried Tomatoes - Drained & Chopped
instructions: Press hash browns with paper towels to absorb moisture.
In large bowl, combine hash browns, 1/2 cup onion, 1 tsp. salt and 1/4 tsp. pepper.
Press into bottom of buttered 9 x 13' glass baking dish.
Brush with melted butter.
Bake in a preheated 425 degree oven until lightly browned around edges (20-25 minutes).
In large bowl, whisk together half-and-half, eggs, 1 tsp. salt and 1/2 tsp. pepper.
Stir in cheese, spinach, remaining 1/2 cup onion and tomatoes.
Pour mixture over potato crust.
Bake, uncovered, in a preheated 350 degree oven until center is set (30-45 minutes).
Let stand, covered, 10 minutes; cut into squares.
Serves 8-10.

title: Seven Layer Dip
description: A classic layered dip perfect for parties.
instructions: Using Quiche dish or pie plate, spread guacamole dip across bottom.
Layer chopped onions, tomatoes, green pepper, lettuce, cheddar cheese and taco sauce.
Serve with taco chips.

title: Seven Layer Dip
description: Another version of the classic layered dip.
instructions: In a small dish add one layer of the following:
1 - 16 oz. Can Rosaria Green Chile & Lima Refried Beans
Salsa
Cheese
Sour Cream
Sliced Olives
Diced Tomatoes
Jalapenos (Nacho Rings or Diced)
Serve with taco chips.
notes: The slowest checker is always at the express check-out lane.

title: Southwestern Breakfast Casserole
description: A spicy twist on the classic breakfast casserole.
ingredients: 1 Package (24 oz.) Ore-Ida Southern Style Hash Browns. Frozen
1 Medium Red Bell Pepper - Seeded and Cut Into 6 Rings
instructions: Combine potatoes, cheese and seasonings in 13" x 9" x 2' baking dish, sprayed with non-stick cooking spray.
Arrange pepper rings over top of potato mixture.
Crack one egg into each pepper ring.
Brush eggs with melted butter.
Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until egg whites are set and potatoes are tender.
Makes 6 servings.
notes: NOTE: Chorizo sausage, sauteed and drained, can be added to potato mixture.

title: Tortilla Roll Ups
description: Easy and delicious appetizer rolls.
ingredients: 1 Pkg. Hidden Valley Original Ranch Dressing
instructions: Mix olives, cream cheese and ranch dressing together.
Spread on tortillas.
Sprinkle evenly with remaining ingredients.
Roll up tortilla tightly and chill 2 hours.
Cut into 1' pieces and serve with your favorite salsa or picante sauce.
Makes 3 dozen.

title: Baked Chicken Salad
description: A warm, comforting chicken salad casserole.
instructions: Mix all ingredients, except potato chips.
Spoon in 2 quart casserole.
Cover with crushed potato chips and bake in 400 degree oven for 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
Serves 8.
notes: NOTE: Can be prepared day before serving and refrigerated. Do not add potato chips until ready to bake. Also, I use less mayonnaise. You can also sprinkle shredded cheese on top.
extra_note: Love, like a chicken salad or restaurant hash, must be taken with blind faith or it loses its flavor. - Helen Rowland

title: Whole Wheat Bread
description: A hearty, homemade whole wheat bread.
ingredients: 1- 3.9 oz. Container Applesauce- or- 1 Cube Butter
instructions: In a large bowl combine milk, honey, salt and applesauce. Let cool.
Then add eggs, and the yeast which has been dissolved in the warm water.
Add the flour and stir well.
Cover and let stand in a warm place for 1 hour.
To bake, form and let rise.
Bake at 400 degrees for approximately 20 minutes.
Dough can be stored in refrigerator for up to one week.
This dough will also make rolls.

title: Focaccia
description: A delicious Italian flatbread.
ingredients: 1 (1 lb.) Loaf Frozen Bread Dough- Thawed
instructions: Shape thawed bread dough into a ball.
Press into 10" circle on greased baking sheet.
With finger, poke deep holes in 1" intervals.
Place small amount of garlic in each hole.
Drizzle olive oil over dough; brush lightly to distribute evenly.
Combine cheese and rosemary; sprinkle evenly over surface.
Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (about 20 minutes).
Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven until lightly browned (14-16 minutes).
Cut into wedges.
notes: In Tuscany, olive oil and bread are sacred gifts, and it is a grave sin to waste either of them. The Tuscans say you add years to your time in purgatory with the crumbs left on your plate.

title: Garlic Butter
description: A flavorful spread perfect for garlic bread.
ingredients: 1 Stick Oleo (or Butter If You're Thin)
1 Tbsp. Oil (Omit If You Don't Want Extra Oil)
instructions: Mix until very smooth: oleo, garlic clove, garlic salt, Romano cheese, and oil.
Spread on bread, sprinkle with paprika and/or parsley for color.
Bake at 400 until brown (or slip under broiler for a quick melt).
Keep a batch in the refrigerator for any time.
notes: As for butter versus margarine, I trust cows more than chemists.

title: Homemade Cornbread
description: A classic Southern cornbread recipe with honey butter.
instructions: FOR CORNBREAD: Combine Cornmeal, sugar, eggs, oil, sour cream and cream corn in order listed; mix well.
Pour into greased 9 x 13 pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for approximately 30 minutes.
Makes 12 squares of cornbread.
FOR HONEY BUTTER: Mix softened butter and honey together.
Serve with warm cornbread.

title: Linguine Salad
description: A refreshing pasta salad perfect for summer.
ingredients: 1 - 8 oz. Package Linguine (From Refrigerator Section in Store)
instructions: Cook linguine according to directions.
Rinse with cold water and drain well.
Mix all ingredients together.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
notes: What garlic is to salad, insanity is to art. - Augustus Saint-Gaudens

title: Olympia Salad With Gourmet French Dressing
description: A colorful and flavorful salad with a homemade dressing.
ingredients: 1 Small Red Onion - Sliced in Ringettes
1 tsp. Dry Leaf Sage or Fresh Sage
instructions: In a large salad bowl, tear lettuce into bite size pieces.
Add the red onion, broccoli, mushrooms, and cauliflower.
Sprinkle with crumbled bleu cheese and toss gently.
Refrigerate until ready to use.
Before serving coat with the Gourmet French Dressing.
Gourmet French Dressing: Mix the dressing ingredients in a glass jar.
Double the recipe as necessary (2 Tbsp. Oil to 1 Tbsp. Vinegar), depending on how much salad you are making.
You will need just enough dressing to coat the lettuce.
Refrigerate dressing for at least 2 hours before using.
If you love garlic, add more. I use 2-3 cloves for 6-8 Tbsp. of oil.

title: Onion Bread
description: A savory bread perfect for sandwiches or as a side.
instructions: Mix green onions in oleo and spread on French bread all the way to the edges.
Sprinkle each piece with Salad Supreme and then with Parmesan cheese.
Put under broiler for approximately 1 minute until bread is golden.
Watch carefully so bread does not burn.
notes: Delicious!

title: Pepperoni Bread
description: A flavorful bread filled with pepperoni and cheese.
ingredients: Shredded Cheese - Any Kind You Like
instructions: Dissolve 2 packages of Dry Yeast with 1/4 cup warm water.
Then add to the 4 cups warm water, Salt, Sugar, Oil and Flour.
Knead this real good.
Let rise twice.
Divide into 4 pieces.
Then roll out like a pizza, big enough to fit a 1 lb. bread pan.
Brush dough with beaten egg.
Then line your Pepperoni. Leave a little space on top and sides to seal.
Over the Pepperoni you sprinkle a little chopped onion and whatever cheese you like.
The cheese you do just like you put it on pizza.
Roll up like jelly roll, seal sides and top real good and put in well greased bread pans and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
Make sure you put sealed side on the bottom.
I line my oven with tin foil because sometimes the cheese oozes out.
When done remove immediately and put on rack to cool.

title: Tuna Fish Salad
description: A classic tuna salad with a twist.
ingredients: 1 Package Frozen Green Peas - (Do Not Cook)
instructions: Cook macaroni shells as directed on package, then soak in cold water.
Mix rest of ingredients in a bowl.
Add macaroni shells and mix well.
Cool in refrigerator.

title: Tuna & Macaroni Salad
description: A simple and satisfying tuna pasta salad.
instructions: Cook Creamettes according to directions. When they are done, rinse with cold water and drain well.
Drain tuna and flake with a fork.
Mix mustard and Miracle Whip in a separate bowl (I add a little pepper to this).
Mix Creamettes, tuna, peas and onions together and add Miracle Whip and mustard mix, stir well.
Serve cold or at room temperature.

title: American Chow Mein
description: A hearty and comforting casserole dish.
instructions: Brown meat. Add salt and pepper.
Add rest of everything.
Bake 1 hour or longer at 325 degrees.
Sprinkle with chow mein noodles just before done.
notes: Dining is and always was a great artistic opportunity. - Frank Lloyd Wright

title: Beef Bourguignonne
description: A classic French beef stew.
ingredients: Nice Bunch of Parsley - Minced Fine
1 1/2 Cups Red Wine - Heated to Boiling Point
instructions: Cut pieces of boneless chuck, not too small. Salt, pepper, and flour beef.
Brown in very little fat.
Add onions, parsley, garlic, thyme, bay leaf, and red wine.
When meat is just about done, add ham and fresh mushrooms.
This meat is baked in oven for 3 hours at 300 degrees.
Serve over rice.
notes: * Ham may be "unsmoked" by boiling for 1 minute.

title: Beef Bourguignonne Ala Emmet
description: A variation on the classic French beef stew.
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb. Sirloin Steak - Cut into 1 1/2" Cubes
1 (1 1/2 oz.) Pkg. Dry Onion Soup Mix
1 - 15 oz. Can/ Jar Whole Onions - Drained
instructions: Brown steak in frying pan.
Combine salt, cornstarch, soup mix and wine in 2 Qt. casserole.
Stir in steak, mushrooms, green pepper and onions.
Bake 2 hours or until tender in 325 Degree oven (covered).
Increase wine during cooking if mixture seems dry. (Reserve liquid from onions - it can be added if needed.)
Serve with rice. Serves 4-6.
notes: 'Tis an ill cook that cannot lick his own fingers.

title: Beer Marinade For Ham
description: A flavorful marinade for baked ham.
instructions: Make 1/2 inch deep slits across top of ham.
Bring above ingredients to a boil in sauce pan.
Pour over ham.
Let ham stand overnight or at least 5 hours.
Bake at 300 degrees for 4 to 5 hours, basting frequently.
When done cook remaining liquid down to a thick sauce and spoon over ham.
(Cook ham 10 to 18 minutes per pound. Temperature of ham when done should be 150 to 160 degrees).
notes: Wine is sunlight, held together by water. - Galileo

title: Bisquick Chicken
description: An easy and crispy baked chicken recipe.
instructions: Use 9 x 13 pan. Melt shortening at 425 degrees, very hot.
Oleo and oil should 'sizzle' before putting chicken pieces in pan.
Dip chicken in Bisquick.
Bake 1/2 hour, turn, then bake another half hour.
notes: Laughter is brightest where food is best.

title: Cabbage Rolls
description: Traditional stuffed cabbage rolls in tomato sauce.
instructions: Drop cabbage into boiling water. Cover and leave until leaves loosen (about 30 minutes).
Pull leaves apart.
Mix all sauce ingredients together in a large covered frying pan or dutch oven. Simmer while preparing rolls.
Mix ground beef, onion, egg, rice, milk, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
Form into large balls and roll up inside a cabbage leaf.
Place rolls in sauce and simmer for 2 hours.
Chop up any remaining cabbage and add to sauce, if desired.
notes: Its no use boiling your cabbage twice.

title: Calzone
description: A stuffed Italian bread filled with meats and cheeses.
ingredients: 1 Small Green Pepper, Seeded and Sliced
2 tsp. Olive Oil or Salad Oil
instructions: Prepare dough: Sprinkle yeast into water and let stand for 5 minutes to soften. Stir in salt and oil. Gradually mix in flour to make a soft dough. Turn onto well floured board and knead until smooth and not sticky, adding more flour as needed. Place in greased bowl; turn dough to grease top. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubles, about 1 hour.

Meanwhile, prepare filling: Cook the sliced sausage in a frying pan until it is browned. Add onion, garlic, mushrooms, green pepper and carrots. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until vegetables are limp. Stir in tomato sauce, olives, basil, oregano, sugar and red pepper. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, about 5 minutes. Allow to cool.

After dough has risen, punch it down and divide it in half for 2 large turnovers or into six pieces for individual servings. On a lightly floured board shape each portion into a ball. If making two calzone, roll each out to a circle 11 inches across; if making 6 calzone, roll each out to a circle 6 1/2 inches across. Brush the surface of each circle lightly with oil.
When ready to assemble calzone, stir mozzarella, Parmesan, salt and pepper into sausage mixture.

Generously grease baking sheets and sprinkle with corn meal. Divide the sausage mixture among the calzone, spreading it over only half of each dough circle. Fold the plain half over the filling, then press edges together. Roll 1/2 inch of pressed edges up and over, then seal and crimp.
With spatula transfer calzone to baking sheets. Pierce tops with fork and brush lightly with more oil.
Bake at 475 degrees for 15-20 minutes for either size until well browned.
6 servings

title: Chicken Cacciatore
description: A classic Italian hunter-style chicken dish.
instructions: In sauce pan bring to boil oleo, water and cocoa.
Remove from heat and stir in sugar and flour until well mixed.
Add buttermilk, eggs, baking soda and vanilla. Mix well.
Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes in a greased and floured jelly roll pan.
For frosting: In a sauce pan bring the oleo, cocoa and milk to a boil.
Remove from heat and add powdered sugar and vanilla.
Beat until reaches spreading consistency.
Stir in walnuts.
Spread on warm brownies.

title: Chicken Italiano
description: A flavorful Italian-style chicken dish.
instructions: Combine first three ingredients to make a sauce, set aside.
Combine next three ingredients on wax paper.
Dip chicken in the egg and roll in corn flakes mixture.
Place chicken in baking dish and pour sauce over the top.
Bake at 300 degrees for the first 20 minutes.
Then turn chicken over and sprinkle with the pizza cheese and continue baking for an additional 20 minutes.
Serves 4.
notes: Poultry is for the cook what canvas is for the painter. - Brillat-Savarin

title: Chili Con Carne
description: A hearty chili dish with hamburger and kidney beans.
ingredients: 2 Cans Tomatoes - Broken Up or Mash
instructions: In butter, brown onion, celery and green pepper (optional).
Add hamburger and brown.
Add tomatoes. Simmer about 10 minutes.
Add kidney beans.
Add chili powder, all-spice, sugar, salt and pepper to taste.
Cook slowly - about 2 hours or so.
notes: NOTE: This is a double recipe. Empty stomachs are wiser than empty heads- they talk only once in a while.

title: Chop Suey Bake Dish
description: An Asian-inspired casserole with ground beef and rice.
instructions: Brown the hamburger, salt and pepper, onion and celery.
Mix in the soup, uncooked rice, water and soy sauce.
Simmer 1/2 hour.
Bake 1 1/2 to 2 hours at 350 degrees.
notes: Easy and tasty. Rice is born in water and must die in wine. - Old Italian Proverb

title: Clam Linguine
description: A simple and delicious pasta dish with clams.
ingredients: 2-8 oz. Cans Minced Clams - Reserve Juice
instructions: Saute garlic in olive oil.
Add juice of clams. Simmer 10 minutes and add clams, pepper and parsley.
Simmer 5 minutes.
Pour over hot linguine.
Sprinkle with grated cheese.
Toss and serve hot.
notes: Serves 4. He who giveth up olive oil gives up his good taste. - Provencal Proverb

title: Easy Manicotti
description: A simple and delicious stuffed pasta dish.
ingredients: 1/4 lb. Cooked, Drained Italian Sausage, Thin Sliced or Ground
2 Cups (8 oz.) Shredded Jack and/or Mozzarella Cheese
instructions: Pour 1/2 cup of tomato sauce into 9 inch square baking pan. Set aside.
Prepare filling and stuff into uncooked shells.
Place shells into pan and cover with remaining sauce.
Cover with foil.
Bake in 400 degree oven for 30-35 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheese and bake uncovered for about 10 minutes.
Let stand for about 10 minutes before serving.
notes: This is very easy to double and amenable to alterations. For example, drained, chopped spinach can be used in place of the ground beef in the filling.

title: Easy One Pot Meal
description: A simple and hearty one-pot meal with ground beef and potatoes.
ingredients: 1 Can Whole Tomatoes - Crushed (with a CLEAN HAND)
instructions: Cook ground beef and onion in large pan (crumble beef as you cook).
When this is done add the sliced potatoes and enough water to cover the beef and 1/2 of the potatoes, and cover.
When potatoes are tender, add your crushed tomatoes and juice from the can.
When tomatoes are hot your meal is ready.
notes: I serve salad and choice of dressing with this meal. It's so easy! What I say is that, if a fellow really likes potatoes, he must be a pretty decent fellow. -A.A. Milne

title: Family Steak Marinade
description: A flavorful marinade for steak.
ingredients: 1 Tbsp. Garlic Salt (Less If Using Garlic Powder)
instructions: Mix together all ingredients.
Poke holes every 2 inches over steak top, marinate in mixture overnight.
Sear 3 minutes on each side.
Then cook 10 minutes on one side and 15 minutes on the other side.
Do Not Overcook!
Slice diagonally and serve.
notes: We like to eat this rare. If you accept a dinner invitation- you have a moral obligation to be amusing. - The Duchess of Windsor

title: Italian Beef Sandwiches
description: Slow-cooked beef for delicious sandwiches.
ingredients: 4 lb. Rolled Rump Roast or Beef Tip Roast
instructions: Heat oven to 325 degrees.
Place roast in large roasting pan.
Combine remaining ingredients and pour over roast.
Cover; bake 3 hours.
Refrigerate meat for 4 hours, reserving sauce.
Slice meat thinly and combine with reserved sauce.
Simmer 30 minutes or until ready to serve.
Serve on dollar buns.
notes: Makes 36 small sandwiches. Garlic is the catsup of intellectuals.

title: Lasagna
description: A classic Italian layered pasta dish.
ingredients: 2 Large Cans Mushrooms or Fresh Mushrooms
2 Large Packages Shredded Monterey Jack Cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Make sauce with ingredients above.
Brown sausage, hamburger, onions, mushrooms, and green peppers. Add to sauce.
Combine the cheeses together and put aside.
In a 9 x 13 pan, add enough water just to cover the bottom of the pan.
Add the uncooked noodles, followed by a layer of sauce and then a layer of cheese.
Repeat the layering until you have 3 layers, ending with a layer of cheese.
Bake for 1 hour.

title: Lasagna Rolls
description: A unique twist on traditional lasagna.
ingredients: 1 (10 oz.) Pkg. Frozen Chopped Spinach, Thawed
1 1/3 Cups Ricotta or Cream Style Cottage Cheese
instructions: Cook noodles following package directions. Drain, rinse with cold water, drain on paper towels.
Squeeze excess moisture from spinach; combine with Parmesan, ricotta, salt, pepper and nutmeg.
Spread about 1/3 cup cheese mixture along entire length of each noodle, roll noodles up jelly roll fashion beginning at narrow edge. Set aside.
Brown beef and garlic in oil in large skillet, stir in spaghetti sauce, basil and oregano; simmer 5 minutes.
Pour sauce into an 8 x 12 inch greased baking dish.
Gently push noodle swirl into sauce. Cover with foil.
Bake in a 350 degree oven until bubbly in center (about 30 minutes).
Remove foil, sprinkle with parsley and grated cheese.
notes: Serves 4-6. Tip: If made ahead and refrigerated, bake 50 - 60 minutes.

title: Lean Baked Rigatoni
description: A healthier version of baked pasta with ground turkey.
instructions: Brown in the olive oil the ground turkey, garlic and onion.
Then add the sage, oregano, basil and jar of spaghetti sauce.
Let simmer for 20 minutes.
Cook Rigatoni according to package directions and place in a 9 x 13 inch pan.
Add the above meat sauce to the pasta and cover with Mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Bake 15 - 20 minutes at 350 degrees.
notes: Makes 8 servings. Be moderate in order to taste the joys of life in abundance. - Epicurus

title: Lobster Ravioli
description: A luxurious pasta dish featuring lobster-filled ravioli.
ingredients: 1 tsp. Chopped Fresh Herbs (Basil, Thyme, and Parsley)
1/2 Sheet Each Tomato, Egg & Spinach Pasta*
Beaten Egg to Brush on Pasta
instructions: To make filling, saute the shallots about 1 minute in the olive oil.
Add the lobster meat and herbs. Remove from heat and mix in the goat cheese. Let cool.
With a 2+-inch cookie cutter, cut 8 circles out of each pasta sheet.
Brush each pasta circle with egg. Place a dollop of filling in the middle and top with second circle of the same color of pasta. Pinch the edges together.
When all circles of all three colors have been filled, cook in boiling salted water for about 4 minutes. Keep hot.
TO SERVE: Spoon Artichoke-Tomato Sauce on individual plate and arrange one ravioli of each color on top of sauce. Garnish with a basil leaf.
notes: * Available at pasta specialty shops. Makes 4 servings.

title: Artichoke Tomato Sauce
description: A flavorful sauce to accompany Lobster Ravioli.
instructions: Saute the shallots, artichokes, sun-dried tomatoes and garlic in olive oil.
Add the vermouth.
Add the cream and let simmer until the sauce becomes creamy.
Add the basil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
notes: Makes 2 1/2 cups. We should look for someone to eat and drink with before looking for something to eat and drink, for dining alone is leading the life of a lion or wolf. - Epicurus

title: Low-fat Spaghetti Pie
description: A healthier version of a pasta-based pie.
instructions: For crust, cook spaghetti according to package directions, except omit the cooking oil and salt. Drain well.
In a small mixing bowl, stir together the egg whites, the Parmesan cheese, and margarine. Stir into the hot cooked spaghetti.
Spray a 9 inch pie plate with nonstick coating. Arrange spaghetti mixture evenly in the bottom and up the sides of the pie plate.
In another bowl stir together the remaining egg whites and the drained cottage cheese. Spread over the crust.
In a large skillet, cook the meat, onion and green pepper until meat is brown. Drain off fat. Stir in the tomato sauce, Italian seasoning and salt. Heat through.
Spoon over cottage cheese mixture in crust.
Bake in 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese.
Bake about 5 minutes more or until cheese melts. Cut into wedges.

title: Marinade For Pork Chops
description: A flavorful marinade for pork chops.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Add pork chops.
Rotate container every couple of hours so that all pork chops are marinated equally.
Best if marinated overnight.
Reserve the remaining marinade for basting on the barbecue or for broiling in the oven.
notes: The best wine is the oldest, the best water the newest. - William Blake

title: Mexican Layered Dish
description: A layered casserole with Mexican flavors.
ingredients: 1 lb. Ground Beef, Pork or Turkey
1 - 11 oz. Can Whole Kernel Corn - Drained
1 - 4 oz. Can Sliced Black Olives - Drained
1 - 4 oz. Can Mild Chiles - Chopped and Drained
instructions: Brown ground meat until no longer pink. Add taco mix and water. Cook until thickens.
Spray 9 x 13 inch pan with Pam.
Place 6 tortillas overlapping on bottom.
Mix salsa and tomato sauce together.
Top tortillas with half of meat, corn, olives and chiles.
Pour half salsa mixture over and half cheese mixture.
Repeat the layer one more time, finishing with cheese.
Bake in 375 Degree oven for 30 minutes or until heated through.

title: Mexican Stuffed Shells
description: Pasta shells with a Mexican-inspired filling.
ingredients: 1 Can (2.8 oz.) Durkee French Fried Onions
1 Can (4 oz.) Chopped Green Chiles - Drained
1 Cup (4 oz.) Shredded Monterey Jack Cheese
instructions: Brown ground beef and drain.
Combine picante sauce, water and tomato sauce; stir 1/2 cup into ground beef along with chiles, 1/2 cup of cheese and 1/2 can Durkee French Fried Onions; mix well.
Pour half of remaining sauce mixture on bottom of 10 inch round or 8 x 11 baking dish.
Stuff cooked shells with ground beef mixture. Arrange shells in baking dish; pour remaining sauce over shells.
Bake, covered, at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Top with remaining cheese and onions; bake, uncovered, 5 minutes longer.

title: Oven Stew
description: A hearty stew cooked slowly in the oven.
instructions: Mix meat with flour to coat.
Put in dutch oven and cover with vegetables, which have been cut into large chunks, layered in order given.
Mix gravy mix with 1 cup water. Add wine and bouillon cube in another 1 cup of water.
Add bay leaf and a few cloves.
Pour over mixture and bake in 275 Degree oven for 5 hours.
Do not stir until served.
Salt & Pepper to taste.
notes: If beef's the king of meat, potato's the queen of the garden world.

title: Pesto Sauce
description: A classic Italian sauce made with basil and pine nuts.
instructions: In blender put basil, parsley, garlic and pine nuts.
Add oil and melted butter, cheese and mix well.
Cook linguine, save about 2 cups pasta water before draining in case pesto is too thick.
Coat linguine with pesto sauce and serve.
notes: A man taking basil from a woman will love her always. - Sir Thomas More

title: Poor Boy Lasagna
description: A simplified version of lasagna.
ingredients: 3 Cups Spaghetti Sauce (32 oz. Ragu or Whatever Type You Like)
instructions: Brown the hamburger, seasoned with the salt and pepper.
Add spaghetti sauce.
Cook the lasagna noodles just until softened, drained, and put in cold water.
Layer in a 9 x 13 pan: some sauce, layer of noodles, some hamburger with sauce, some grated mozzarella cheese, some Parmesan cheese, and some Romano cheese.
Keep layering until you run out of space.
Bake 1 hour at 350 degrees.

title: Quick Round Steak
description: A quick and easy way to prepare round steak.
instructions: Slice round steak first into serving pieces; then cut lengthwise so it will be nice and thin.
Tenderize pieces with meat tenderizer.
Put oil in pan, steak with lots of parsley and minced garlic.
Fry fast on top of stove, with cover on pan always.
Takes 10 or 15 minutes and is very flavorful.

title: Savory Spaghetti Pie
description: A unique twist on spaghetti, baked in a pie form.
instructions: Heat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9" inch pie plate with non-stick cooking spray.
Cook spaghetti to desired doneness as directed on package.
In medium bowl, combine cooked spaghetti, egg and Parmesan cheese.
Arrange spaghetti in bottom and up sides of prepared pan to form crust; set aside.
In large skillet over medium heat, brown ground beef with onion, green pepper and mushrooms. Cook until no longer pink; drain.
Stir in spaghetti sauce and mozzarella.
Spoon cottage cheese over bottom of spaghetti crust. Top with hamburger mixture.
Bake at 350 for 30 to 35 minutes or until heated through.
notes: Serves 6.

title: Sherry Beef
description: A rich, flavorful beef dish cooked with sherry.
ingredients: 1 Cup Sherry (Not Cooking Sherry, The Real Stuff)
instructions: Brown the steak.
Put in Dutch oven or any heavy baking dish.
Pour over the mushroom soup, sherry, and onion soup mix.
Cover and bake at 325 degrees for about 3 hours (or until tender).
Saute some celery, onion and garlic in butter.
Cook wide egg noodles.
Pour saute over noodles and serve with sherry beef mix on top.
notes: Terrific flavor.

title: Stir Fry
description: A quick and easy stir fry dish with sirloin steak.
ingredients: 1 lb. Sirloin Steak - Cut in Small strips
instructions: Marinate the sirloin in the garlic, onion, soy sauce, and red wine for at least 2 hours.
Heat frying pan with oil until hot.
Add steak - stirring continually for 3 minutes.
Add vegetables and stir for 2 minutes more.
Use as a side dish or over rice.
notes: Wine is the pleasantest subject in the world to discuss. All its associations are with occasions when people are at their best: with relaxation, contentment, leisurely meals and the free flow of ideas. - Hugh Johnson

title: Swiss Steak
description: A classic dish of tenderized round steak cooked with vegetables.
instructions: Cut round steak in large pieces and sprinkle with mixture of flour and salt and pepper.
Pound until rather thin.
Brown steak and onions in small amount of hot oil.
Add water to cover meat and simmer covered for 30 to 45 minutes, adding water if needed.
Add carrots and cook until carrots are done.
Thicken with flour.
Serve over mashed potatoes.
notes: Serves 4. The more food you prepare, the less your guests eat.

title: Tatertot And Hamburger Hot
description: A simple casserole with hamburger and tater tots.
instructions: Brown hamburger and add a little onion while browning.
When brown put in a baking dish.
Put frozen Tatertots over hamburger.
Add cream of mushroom soup which has been dissolved in 1 cup of water. Pour this over potatoes.
Place cheese slices on top.
Put in 350 degree oven for 30 to 35 minutes - until cheese starts to bubble.

title: Twinkie Baked Beans
description: A unique and hearty bean dish.
ingredients: 1 lb. Lean Ground Beef - Cooked and Drained
instructions: Mix beef, onion, brown sugar, catsup, mustard and beans in ungreased 3 quart casserole.
Cover and bake in 375 degree oven until bubbly, about 45 minutes.
Mix baking mix, milk, and chili powder until soft dough forms, about 30 seconds.
Turn onto surface well floured with baking mix. Coat and knead 10 times.
Cut into circles with 2 inch round cutter.
Arrange on hot bean mixture.
Bake uncovered until golden brown, about 15 minutes.

title: Antipasto
description: A traditional Italian appetizer platter.
ingredients: 2 - Cauliflower - Pull Apart In Small Pieces
instructions: When vegetables are done put in 1 pint jars that have been put in boiling water to sterilize.
Fill 3/4 full and put cover on tight.
Put in canner with water up to the neck of the jars and let come to a boil and steam them for 15 to 20 minutes.
Remove and put on counter top over night.
Make sure covers all popped.
Then store for future use.

title: Antipasto
description: Another version of the Italian appetizer platter.
instructions: Soak onions, cukes, celery, green pepper and tomatoes in a salted brine over night (each separate).
Boil beans, cauliflower and carrots for 5 minutes, each separate, and let stand.
Use large kettle that will hold all. Start by boiling oil, vinegar, anchovies, tomato paste and ketchup. Boil 10 minutes.
Add: celery, mushrooms, beans, carrots and cauliflower. Boil 10 minutes.
Add: cukes, green tomatoes, onions and peppers and boil 15 minutes.
Last, add olives and tuna. Salt and pepper. Mix well, but carefully.
Pack in hot jars and process 10 minutes. Seal jars and store.
notes: Makes 30 pints.

title: Baccla (Codfish For Polenta)
description: A traditional Italian codfish dish to serve with polenta.
instructions: Chop onions and garlic and saute in oil.
Then add tomatoes, tomato paste, and pepper.
Add the salt later, if necessary.
Then add the butter towards the end.
Boil codfish for about 4 minutes, not rapidly.
Add to sauce mixture not long before serving.

title: Bagna Cauda (Hot Dip)
description: A warm Italian dip typically served with vegetables.
instructions: In an electric fry pan you put butter, Oil, and Garlic. Cook for 15 minutes then add the anchovies.
Heat for 5 minutes and add pepper - NO SALT.
Then put your pan on low to keep it warm and serve it with these vegetables and Italian bread: Cabbage, Finocchio, Celery, Lettuce.

title: Barley Soup
description: A hearty soup with barley and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 Can Whole Green Beans - Cut Small
1 Small Can Peeled Tomatoes - Cut Small and Save the Juice
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large pot.
Let boil slowly for 3 to 4 hours or until done.
notes: The destiny of nations depends on their manner of eating. -Brillat-Savarin

title: Beans & Potatoes
description: A simple dish of green beans and potatoes.
ingredients: 2 Medium Potatoes - Boiled and Cut in Pieces
instructions: Keep beans and potatoes warm.
Brown salt pork then add garlic and be careful not to burn.
Mix beans and potatoes with salt pork mixture.
Serve immediately.
Salt and pepper to taste.

title: Breaded Cauliflower
description: Crispy breaded cauliflower, baked to perfection.
instructions: Cook cauliflower in salted boiling water about 5 minutes.
Put enough oil in baking dish to cover bottom.
Dip flowerettes in egg and then in cheese and crumbs that have been mixed together.
Place in baking dish.
Bake in 350 degree oven about 20-25 minutes, turning over about half way through so cauliflower will brown on both sides.

title: Broccoli Italian
description: A simple Italian preparation of broccoli.
instructions: Wash broccoli well and cut off tough stalks at end.
Bring salted water to boil and add broccoli.
Just before tender, drain and place in skillet in which crushed garlic has been sauteed in hot olive oil.
Lightly pan fry broccoli in olive oil for about 5 minutes.

title: Calzoni
description: Italian stuffed bread pockets.
ingredients: 1 Cup Oleo (Butter, if you're into authenticity)
instructions: Mix the flour, oleo and salt like pie crust.
Dissolve the yeast in the lukewarm water. Add to the dough the yeast/water, milk, and egg yolks. Set aside.
Mix together the baked ham, Italian sausage - which has been crumbled fine and fried, ricotta, Romano, eggs, garlic, parsley, salt and pepper.
Divide dough into 10 pieces. Roll into a rectangle; put filling on one end; fold dough over filling and seal edges tightly with fork and pierce.
Let stand 1 hour. Brush with egg yolk.
Bake at 375 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until nice and brown.
notes: Makes 10 logs.

title: Calzoni
description: Another version of Italian stuffed bread pockets.
instructions: Mix the ham, sausage, ricotta cheese, Romano cheese, eggs, parsley, garlic salt and pepper together.
In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, margarine and salt like a pie crust.
Add to the flour mixture the yeast, which has been dissolved in the warm water, and the scalded milk and mix.
Then add the egg yolks to the yeast mixture. Mix well.
Divide the dough and filling in 10 portions. Roll out each piece of dough. Add filling on 1/2 the dough and fold over to seal.
Let rise for 1 hour. Brush top with egg yolk and poke with fork.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes at 400 degrees, until brown.
notes: This can be made ahead and refrigerated. Before serving, slice and heat.

title: Calzoni
description: Yet another variation of Italian stuffed bread pockets.
ingredients: 3 Egg Yolks (1 Whole Egg if Dry)
instructions: Mix flour, oleo and salt together.
Beat eggs and milk and mix in with yeast and water.
Add yeast mixture to the flour mixture to make dough.
Roll out dough. Put filling in and fold dough over top, fork them to seal edges.
Let rise for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Bake at 400-425 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
Before they begin to brown, brush egg yolk over top and finish to bake and brown.

title: Cavatil (Gnocchi)
description: Italian potato dumplings.
instructions: Mix together the potatoes and hot water.
Then add the egg, salt, oil and flour and knead until smooth.
Put big pot of salted water to boil.
Lightly flour a large cutting board. Roll snakes, about the diameter of your little finger: cut into 3/4 inch pieces.
With index and middle fingers together, ("dig") roll each piece against the board to make a "shell".
Put shells on lightly floured cookie sheet, separate to keep them from sticking.
Pour into boiling water, keeping as much loose flour out as possible.
After water reboils, cook for 8-10 minutes. Taste for eating texture.
Drain.
Put some spaghetti sauce into bottom of 9 x 13 pan: add cavatil layer; add sauce; sprinkle with Romano; add more cavatil, sauce, etc.
We usually put in oven to keep warm while we make the next batch, but you can serve immediately. Don't let them bake, however; they'll get too dry.
notes: Serves approximately 6 BIG eaters. We do two batches in order to have leftovers. We usually work as a team: faster and more fun. One person rolls "snakes" and cuts; 1-2 "dig" each noodle.

title: Chicken Cacciatore
description: Italian hunter-style chicken.
ingredients: 1 tsp. Dry Leaf Sage or Fresh Sage
instructions: Strain all of the above 9 items.
In a big fry pan you saute the following: oil, garlic, wine, vinegar and spices.
You brown chicken pieces on both sides.
Then you put them all in a roast pan and pour the top items that were strained over the chicken and bake at 350 degrees until chicken is tender.

title: Chicken With Garlic and Salami
description: A flavorful chicken dish with garlic and salami.
instructions: Be sure chicken is very dry, after washing.
Put oil on bottom of pan, salt and pepper chicken.
Put Salvia over chicken.
Mix in a glass the following: bit pieces of salami, white wine, rosemary, and garlic.
Bake chicken at 350 degrees with cover on pan to begin with.
Then uncover chicken later.
About a half hour before chicken is done, pour the salami/wine mixture over the chicken.

title: Cooked Cabbage Nona Tumini
description: A simple Italian-style cooked cabbage dish.
ingredients: 1 Small to Medium Head of Cabbage
instructions: Cut up cabbage and drop into pot of salted boiling water. Boil cabbage until it is tender, then drain.
In a deep frying pan put in enough olive oil to cover bottom of pan.
Add garlic and saute until browned.
Add cabbage and let simmer.
After cabbage has simmered for a while add a little bit of butter and cinnamon, if desired.
Cook covered until cabbage reaches desired tenderness.
Take cover off of pan and let cook a little bit before serving.

title: Easy Microwave Polenta
description: A quick and easy method for making polenta in the microwave.
instructions: Put all ingredients in a glass bowl and stir real good with a fork.
Place in microwave uncovered.
Cook on High for 15 minutes, stopping to stir well after each 5 minutes of cooking (3 times).
Polenta should be nice and creamy and ready to serve.
If you like a drier or firmer polenta, microwave longer, but do it 1 or 2 minutes at a time and stir in between.
notes: NOTE: Because all microwaves vary, you may need to cook longer than 15 minutes to achieve your desired consistency.

title: Eggplant
description: A simple Italian eggplant dish.
ingredients: 1/4 Large Onion (or 1/2 Medium Onion) - Chopped Fine
instructions: First, make sugo: Put all sugo ingredients on stove cold.
Eggplant: Slice in circles, after paring. Fry in butter (uses quite a bit of butter). Put aside.
When all fried, simmer in sugo for at least an hour.

title: Fruna
description: A hearty bean and bread dish.
instructions: Soak beans overnight and drain.
Cover with cold water and cook until beans are tender.
Make sure after cooked that beans are covered with water.
Cook celery until tender and drain. Add to bean mixture.
Fry bacon till crisp and break into pieces, then add to rest of mixture.
Break enough bread into cubes and into mixture until it thickens.
Add salt and pepper to taste and cook until thick.
notes: Makes a large service.

title: Fruna
description: Another version of the hearty bean and bread dish.
instructions: Boil big pan of potatoes (don't drain off water).
Fry the bacon and garlic, until crisp. Save the garlic grease.
Mash potatoes with the water and the garlic-flavored grease.
Add the crumbled bread. Mix until consistency of smooth mashed potatoes.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Put bacon on top.
notes: The Niclk Reeds' serve this with fried green peppers and Italian sausage. For added pizzazz, they sprinkle with crushed red pepper.

title: Giambotte
description: A hearty Italian sausage and vegetable dish.
ingredients: 2 lb. Sweet or Spicy Italian Sausage, Sliced (or a Mix of Both)
instructions: Rinse a large skillet. While the pan is still wet, put over medium heat and add the sausage.
Turn down the heat very low and saute until the sausage is browned. Remove the sausage and set aside in a bowl.
Drain excess fat left from sausage (more if using a non-stick pan).
Saute the chicken pieces in the oils from the sausage in the skillet. Turn the heat down low and saute, covered, until the chicken pieces are very tender. Transfer them to the bowl with the sausage.
In the same skillet, heat up the olive oil and add the potatoes, peppers, and onion. Brown the vegetables over low heat.
Stir in the oregano. When the vegetables become tender, season them with salt and pepper.
Add the browned sausages and chicken, and saute until all the flavors are mixed together and the sausage and vegetables are tender.
For additional spiciness, stir in the hot red pepper flakes.
notes: Serves 4-6.

title: Gnocchi
description: Italian potato dumplings.
instructions: Mix mashed potatoes, flour, egg and salt in a bowl; knead gently on floured board.
Then cut dough in half and roll each piece into a long rope about one inch in diameter.
Cut into one inch pieces. Lightly flour them and let stand on floured surface, seeing that they don't touch one another for at least 30 minutes.
Keep turning them over so they can dry.
Place in a large kettle of boiling water. Stir lightly and when they start coming to the top, boil slowly for 8 minutes or until cooked.
Sample one. If done, drain and put your favorite sauce and cheese on.
They are ready to serve.
notes: Makes 70 dumplings.

title: Gnocchi
description: Another version of Italian potato dumplings.
instructions: Boil the potatoes until done. Drain and mash them. Let them cool.
When cool add the flour and knead until right consistency.
In a little pan boil the water and drop a couple of gnocchi in to see if they hold together. If not you will have to add more flour.
You make a rope like out of the dough and cut them in 1 inch pieces.
Fill a large kettle 3/4 full of water and let it come to a boil and add a little salt in the water.
Then add a little bit of the gnocchi at a time. As soon as the gnocchi come to the top, let them boil for a little bit and remove from the water.
After they are drained you add your sauce and Italian grated cheese and serve.

title: Gnocchi
description: Yet another version of Italian potato dumplings.
instructions: Peel and boil potatoes until all hardness is removed.
Using a ricer, rice all potatoes into a large bowl.
While potatoes are still warm, add 1 cup flour, egg, Parmesan cheese and butter.
Using a fork mix ingredients together until they begin to come together.
Begin mixing with your hands as soon as it begins to form a dough and do this until thoroughly mixed.
Add a small amount of flour if dough continues to be moist.
Cut a section of dough approximately 2" x 3" and roll it out into a long snake, about 1' in diameter, on a floured board.
Using your fingers, put dimples in the roll about 1' apart. Cut the little sections out equally leaving the dimples in the center.
Continue rolling out and cutting the remaining dough.
Drop gnocchi in a large pan of boiling water. When gnocchi rise to the top they are done.
Compliment with your favorite sauce and serve immediately.
notes: Serves 4.

title: Gnocchi Or Egg Noodles
description: Basic recipe for Italian gnocchi or egg noodles.
instructions: Mix until smooth.
For spaghetti, lasagna, or ravioli.
You can roll these by hand, but we recommend a spaghetti machine from Sears or wherever. It's much easier on you and more uniform product.
notes: This recipe will make about 50 ravioli.

title: Green Beans with Garlic
description: A simple and flavorful green bean side dish.
instructions: Cook green beans until tender.
Drain and add oil, vinegar, garlic and parsley.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Toss and cool.
notes: The trouble with eating Italian food is that five or six days later you're hungry again. - George Miller.

title: Hamburger a la Cacciatore
description: A hamburger dish with Italian flavors.
ingredients: 3 Slices Bread - Cubed and Soaked In 1/3 Cup Milk (or more)
instructions: For patties: Put bread cubes in bowl with milk. Be sure it is soaked good.
Add chopped onions, Italian seasoning, nutmeg, garlic powder, salt, pepper, egg and parsley flakes.
Mix thoroughly. Add to the ground beef and make sure it is really mixed.
You can fry a little to make sure you have enough salt and pepper to your taste.
Form into patties and fry them on both sides. Remove them and put them into the sauce.
For sauce: Cook for one hour slowly then add your patties and simmer for 1/2 hour and serve over noodles.

title: Italian Bean Soup
description: A hearty Italian bean soup.
ingredients: 2 Large Pork Hocks or 4 Small Ones
4 Large Garlic Pieces Chopped Fine - OR - 1/2 Tbsp. Garlic Powder
3 (16 oz.) Cans Pinto Beans - Do Not Drain
instructions: Saute onions in the oil and put pork hocks in at the same time.
Add the garlic and let it cook, but don't burn the garlic.
Add your pinto beans.
When all is in add 6 1/2 Quarts of water.
Let come to a rolling boil and lower to simmer and let cook 3 1/2 hours, covered.

title: Italian Filled Chicken
description: Chicken stuffed with a flavorful Italian filling.
ingredients: Gizzard, Liver, Etc. From Chicken - Ground
instructions: Brown the veal, pork, gizzard, liver, etc. in shortening. Season with salt & pepper.
When cool, add dill, parsley, salvia, rosemary, and garlic which have been chopped together.
Next add eggs, dry bread crumbs, and grated cheese. This should "form" in hands. Add a little water if this is too dry.
Flour chicken lightly before seasoning. Salt and pepper inside of chicken before filling.
Bake at 325 degrees for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.

title: Italian Fried Chicken
description: A crispy, Italian-seasoned fried chicken.
instructions: Mix bread crumbs, salt, pepper, oregano, grated cheese and garlic powder together.
Beat eggs with milk.
Cut chicken in pieces, dip in egg mixture and then in bread crumb mixture to coat.
Fry until brown or golden.
Then put in roaster and bake for 45 minutes at 375 Degrees.

title: Italian Sausage
description: Homemade Italian sausage recipe.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Make it as hot as you like by adjusting the red pepper.
We don't have gut or a machine for stuffing; we either make patties or fry in small chunks.
notes: This was sold in Reed's Market in Duluth for years.

title: Lasagna
description: Classic Italian layered pasta dish.
ingredients: 1 lb. Italian Sausage, Bulk Pork Sausage, or Ground Beef
1 lb. Mozzarella Cheese - Sliced Very Thin
instructions: Brown meat slowly. Spoon off excess fat.
Add next 6 ingredients. Simmer uncovered until sauce is thick, 45 minutes to 1 hr., stirring occasionally.
Cook noodles until tender and drain. Rinse noodles in cold water.
Meanwhile, combine ricotta cheese with eggs, seasonings and Parmesan cheese.
Place half the cooked noodles in a 13x9x2 baking dish.
Spread half of the ricotta cheese mixture over; add half of the Mozzarella cheese and half the meat sauce.
Repeat layers.
Bake at 375 Degrees for 30 minutes.
Let stand 15 minutes before cutting in squares, filling will set slightly.
notes: Makes 12 servings.

title: Leg of Lamb
description: Marinated and grilled leg of lamb.
ingredients: 6- 7 lb. Leg of Lamb - Boned and Butterflied
2 Tbsp. Chopped Fresh Rosemary or 2 tsp. Dried, Crushed Rosemary
instructions: Marinate lamb for approximately one hour.
Cook on outdoor grill or under preheated broiler for 10-12 minutes on each side.
Heat remaining marinade and pour over the lamb.

title: Meatballs And Sugo
description: Italian meatballs with tomato sauce.
instructions: Mix together the meatball ingredients well. Form into meatballs (about 12-15).
Brown in oven in small amount of oil. Turn to brown on all sides.
Remove from oven and add Sugo ingredients.
Simmer covered for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, adding water if sugo becomes too thick.
May add red wine.

title: Minestrone Soup
description: Hearty Italian vegetable soup.
ingredients: 2 Potatoes - Whole and Strained after Cooking
2 Carrots - Whole and Strained after Cooking
instructions: Generously cover vegetables with water.
After letting boil quite a while, add oil, butter, salt & pepper.
Allow soup to consume (with cover off for awhile).
Half hour before serving, add pasta.

title: Nona's Bean Soup
description: A hearty Italian bean soup recipe.
ingredients: 1 Pkg. Dry Pinto Beans - Soaked Overnight
3 Medium Potatoes - Chopped in Large Pieces
2 Beef Bouillon Cubes in 2 Cups Water
instructions: Brown sausage, add beans, onion and celery and cover with water. Cook until beans are tender.
Add carrots and cook another 10-15 minutes.
Add potatoes and spaghetti. Continue cooking until spaghetti is done.
Add salt, pepper and sprinkle with a little cayenne pepper.
To make sure there is enough liquid, I add bouillon with water as I go along.
Serve with Parmesan cheese.

title: Pan E Cotta
description: An Italian bread and cabbage dish.
ingredients: Italian Bread, Cut in Thick Slices (1" Thick)
instructions: Boil cabbage in salted water until tender.
Butter a 4 Quart Pan.
Lay cut bread to cover bottom of pan.
Place cabbage sliced in pieces to cover bread. Sprinkle with cheese.
Lay another layer of bread on top of this and repeat cabbage pieces and cheese over that.
Repeat layers until about 2 inches from top of pan, ending with a layer of cheese.
Pour chicken broth over all to soak bread.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or more.
Keep adding broth as it evaporates, using just enough to keep bread covered.
The bread will fluff up and it will look like a souffle when done.
Bread should be slightly brown on top when done.

title: Panada Ala Emmet
description: A simple Italian bread soup for babies.
instructions: In small saucepan bring salted water to boil and add bread.
Stir until thickens.
Drop in egg and stir.
notes: We fed this to our kids as babies at least 4-5 times a week and oh, how they loved it! Serves 1.

title: Panettone - Holiday Sweet Bread
description: Traditional Italian holiday bread.
ingredients: 1 Cup Milk - Scalded and Cool to Lukewarm
1/2 lb. (2 Cups or 8 oz. pkg.) Blanched Whole Almonds
1/2 lb. (3 Cups) Dark Raisins - Soak and Drain Well
3 Candied Fruits - 6 oz. Each (Red & Green Cherries; Pineapple & Candied Peel)
instructions: Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water and let sit 15 to 20 minutes.
Add to yeast and water the lukewarm milk, butter, eggs, sugar and stir or mix really well.
Now add Anise extract and Aniseed.
Next add 1 Cup flour and mix well. Now add salt.
Next add raisins, almonds, candied fruit.
Be sure to add flour 1 Cup at a time. Dough should not stick to hands or floured surface.
Raise dough until double in bulk.
Divide dough into 3 equal parts. Then shape into loaves.
Round loaves should be shaped like a huge hamburger bun.
Put in greased round 8" or 9" layer cake pans or in 12" loaf pan or Angel Food pan. Use good heavy pans.
Then let dough raise in pan until double in bulk.
Then bake at 350 Degrees for 40 minutes.
When done cool 15 minutes and remove from pan to cooling racks.
Cool completely before wrapping and especially for freezing.
If you serve warm from oven, sprinkle top with granulated sugar while warm.
DO NOT PUT SUGAR ON LOAVES THAT YOU FREEZE.

title: Passatelli
description: Italian soup with bread and cheese dumplings.
instructions: Mix Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, eggs, flour and nutmeg to consistency of pie crust dough and put through fine chopper of grinder.
Spread on cookie sheet to dry.
Drop into boiling chicken broth and cook about 10 minutes.

title: Pasta Alio Olio / Linguine
description: Simple Italian pasta dish with garlic and oil.
instructions: Melt butter and oil together in medium saucepan.
Add garlic and simmer lightly until garlic is soft, but not brown.
Add chopped parsley and pour over hot noodles.
Stir well and add cheese.
Serve immediately.
Add extra cheese if desired.
notes: NOTE: Increase or decrease garlic as desired.

title: Pasta Butter
description: A simple pasta dish for children.
instructions: Into salted boiling water add pasta and cook until tender.
Drain and leave enough water to cover pasta.
Add a chunk of butter and egg.
Stir until egg is cooked.
notes: I ate this as a child and my children also ate it and loved it.

title: Peperonata
description: Italian pepper and tomato side dish.
ingredients: 3 Green Peppers - Medium to Large In Slices
instructions: Place a small amount of olive oil in frying pan.
Saute onion and pepper.
Then add tomatoes.
Simmer until all vegetables are soft and juices from vegetables dries up a bit.
Add salt, pepper and red pepper flakes.
notes: Good as a side dish with meat or chicken.

title: Pasties
description: Traditional meat and vegetable filled pastry.
ingredients: 1-1 1/2 lb. Round Steak - Cut in Small Pieces
instructions: Dough: Cut flour, lard and salt until pea shaped lumps appear. Mix together cold water, egg and white vinegar with a fork and add to the flour mixture to create dough.
Roll dough out into 8" circles (approximately).
Layer filling on one-half of the circle, in the following order: potatoes, carrots, meat and onions. Then salt and pepper. Add a tab of butter on top.
Fold over dough to cover filling and with a fork or your fingers seal edges well.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until done.
For family style, eliminate bottom crust and layer filling in a cake pan. Cover filling with dough crust and bake as directed above.
notes: Freezes well. Makes 4-6 Large pasties. NOTE: Over the years I have learned how to cut corners and now use ready made pie crusts for the dough.

title: Pollo Alla Cacciatora
description: Italian hunter-style chicken.
instructions: Put enough oil in roasting pan to cover bottom.
Saute onion.
Add chicken pieces that have been salted and peppered.
Cook in 325 degree oven for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
About half way through, sprinkle on small amount of garlic powder and red pepper flakes.
Turn chicken often and if it gets dry add some water.
About a half an hour before it's done, add white wine.
Serve over polenta.
notes: This meal was our Sunday meal for many years. An all time favorite of ours. Usually served with green beans or cabbage.

title: Polenta De Patate
description: A hearty potato and cheese dish.
ingredients: 1 lb. Italian Salami (in one chunk) - Cubed
Salt & Pepper to Taste - Not Too Much (Cheese & Salami are Salty)
instructions: In a large fry pan, put your butter and onions and saute them.
Then add the salami, but just until it changes color, don't let it cook too long.
Drain potatoes and mash them.
Add buckwheat flour, enough to hold it together and stir for about 15 minutes.
Then add your salami with the onions. Stir in real good.
At the end you add your cubed cheese and stir good until all melted.
When done I pour it in a 9" x 13" cake pan.
You cut it like cake.
Left over you can put each piece in saran wrap and in baggy and freeze.
You can thaw out and warm in oven or microwave oven.
notes: Very good!

title: Polenta Sausage Torte
description: A layered dish with polenta and sausage.
instructions: In a 2-Qt. saucepan bring 1 1/2 Cups water to boiling. Meanwhile, combine remaining 1 cup water, cornmeal, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Slowly pour cornmeal mixture into boiling water, stirring constantly.
Using a wooden spoon, cook and stir until thick and bubbly. Cook over low heat 5 minutes more or until very thick, stirring frequently.

Spoon half of the polenta mixture into a greased 8" inch springform pan (or an 8" cake pan); cover the surface of the polenta with waxed paper. Pat the polenta into an even layer on the bottom of the pan.
Repeat with remaining polenta in the bottom of an 8" inch round cake pan that has been lined with waxed paper. Set the cake pan aside.
Place the springform pan on a baking sheet. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook finely crumbled sausage, chopped green pepper, carrot, and onion until sausage is brown and vegetables are tender. Drain well.
Stir in tomato paste and Romano cheese.
Spoon the sausage mixture evenly over the baked polenta.
Carefully invert the unbaked polenta layer on top.
Bake, uncovered, on a baking sheet at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Top with green pepper slices and Provolone cheese; bake 5 to 10 minutes more or until cheese is melted and torte is hot.
Remove from oven; let stand 5 minutes.
Run a thin spatula around the outer rim of springform pan to loosen edge. remove pan side.
Slice torte into wedges.
notes: Makes 6 main-dish servings. (Torte may be refrigerated at this point up to 24 hours and baked later).

title: Pork Sausage
description: Homemade Italian pork sausage recipe.
ingredients: Standard Portion: 20 lbs. Lean Pork Butts - Course Ground
1/4 Cup Wine per 10 lbs. - Use Your Own Judgment
instructions: Mix all of the above ingredients thoroughly.
Hog Casings: Come packed in salt and should be refrigerated until ready to use.
Soak casings in cold water 2 hours prior to use.
Run water through casings before using.

title: Porketta
description: Italian-style roasted pork.
ingredients: 2 Cups Fresh Dill - Chopped (Feathery Part Only)
4 tsp. Salt (Reserve Some For Outside of Roast)
2 tsp. Pepper (Reserve Some for Outside of Roast)
instructions: Cut butt in slices about 3/4 inch apart, but not all the way to bottom or ends.
Mix together the parsley, dill, salt, pepper, rosemary, and garlic.
Fill openings with chopped mixture and tie to keep from falling open.
Rub or sprinkle outside of roast with remaining salt and pepper mixture.
Bake at 325 degrees for 2-3 hours or until done.
About a half hour before roast is done, pour wine over roast and baste.
When done, remove roast from pan, adding a little to the brownings.
Scrape and remove brownings from pan and pour into separate container.
Let brownings cool so you can remove fat from top - save the gel.
With your hands, pull meat apart in small pieces, removing fat and gristle.
Mix meat and filling well together. Add some gel. Mix and taste.
If too dry, add more gel. Salt and pepper if needed.
Serve with hard rolls.

title: Potica A la Midwest Counter
description: A sweet, rolled nut bread from Slovenia.
ingredients: 1 Pkg. Dry Yeast (Not Active or Quick Rise)
1/4 Cup Half & Half or Light Cream
instructions: Dough: Let yeast and sugar sit in bowl to activate for 15 - 20 minutes. Add lukewarm milk, butter and eggs and mix good.
Add 1 cup of the flour and mix well. Add salt and remaining flour, a little at a time, by handfuls, until dough is smooth and elastic and does not stick to hands or work surface.
Knead dough for 3 to 5 minutes. Place dough in a greased bowl, flip dough to grease top of dough.
Cover and let rise in warm place until doubles, about 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Gently punch or push down dough and let it raise again for another 10 minutes.
Filling: In a 2 or 3 Quart bowl, mix all ingredients together until egg and sugar are well blended with the other ingredients.
Set aside until dough is ready. If filling thickens while setting, use a small amount of milk and stir well until it is easily spreadable.
Grease 2 (12" x 3 1/2" x 2 1/2") long loaf pans. Use Pam Spray. You could use 4 (8" x 4" x 2") regular bread pans.
Cut sections with glass saucer to pinch and seal ends. Preheat oven to 325 Degrees.
Divide dough into 2 parts. Roll out 1 half of dough at a time. Roll first half into a rectangle 13" to 14" long by 24" to 26" wide.
Spread half of the filling on entire rectangle. Then roll up, starting at the 13"to 14"end. Roll tightly and pinch to seal the edges and place in greased loaf pan with seam side facing bottom of pan.
Repeat with 2nd half of dough. Cover and raise for 1 hour.
Then bake for 45 to 55 minutes. Cool 5 minutes on wire rack and then remove from pans.
You may brush tops with melted butter, I prefer to brush just with cold water and cover with towel for 1 hour.
Cool completely on racks before wrapping to store or to freeze.
notes: Can be kept in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

title: Potica Cake
description: Another version of the Slovenian nut roll.
ingredients: 2 Pkgs. Dry Yeast (OK to Use Quick Rise Yeast)
3 Egg Yolks - (Save Egg Whites - At Room Temp.- For the Filling)
instructions: Heat butter and milk until butter is melted. Put aside and cool.
Dissolve yeast in 1/4 Cup warm water. Beat egg yolks, with fork, into mixture.
In separate bowl combine the flour, salt and sugar and mix ingredients well.
Add flour mixture to the yeast, milk mixture and mix with a WOODEN SPOON (no need for a mixer). Beat until smooth and creamy. It will be very thin dough.
Cover bowl with saran wrap and foil and refrigerate overnight or at least 6 hours.
In saucepan, over low heat, blend nuts, cinnamon, sugar and milk (to dissolve the sugar). Stir until mixture thickens (about 10 minutes). Remove from heat and cool.
Beat egg whites until foamy. Slowly add 1 cup sugar and beat until it forms stiff peaks. Fold the egg whites into cooled nut mixture.
Remove dough from refrigerator and with floured hands take out 1/2 of the dough and place on floured board. Roll to approximately 18"x 20" rectangle.
Spread filling to within 1" of all edges. Roll up, beginning with the wide side (like jelly roll). Place in greased bundt pan.
Cut the roll in pan and brush top with milk before repeating for second half of dough.
DO NOT LET RISE. Bake in 350 degree oven for 1 hour plus 5 minutes on middle rack.
Cool for 30 minutes on rack. Remove from the pan, dust lightly with powder sugar when ready to serve (Optional).
notes: It freezes well, but do not sugar before freezing.

title: Potica (Slovenian Putizza)
description: A traditional Slovenian nut roll pastry.
ingredients: 1 1/2 Cups Half & Half -or- Undiluted Carnation Milk
instructions: In a large bowl, combine crumbled yeast, sugar and salt and let stand 10 - 15 minutes.
Add to yeast mixture the eggs, butter, and milk. Begin with 4 to 4 1/2 Cups Flour, add gradually to be sure dough is soft, does not stick to hands, and is elastic.
Let dough sit for 2 hours or more. Dough will look like it did not raise - this is fine.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Mix the filling together well, be sure the eggs are well blended. If the filling seems too thick to spread, add a little more milk. Do not make it too runny.
Put a clean sheet which is big enough to tie each corner around each leg of the table securely to prevent from moving while rolling. Flour the surface of this sheet.
Place dough in center of table and begin to roll. Dough should roll out thin so that you are able to see through it.
When dough is done being rolled then spread at one of the long ends some melted Oleo, about 3' Inches wide.
Next spread the nut filling all over the entire dough evenly, If holes should come, just put filling around them and then proceed to roll up from the long, buttered side, like a jelly roll.
Be sure to prick the dough with a fork every 3 or 4 revolutions.
Then cut sections to fit length of pan and place in a greased (all sides and bottom of pan) 9' x 13' or an 11' x 17' pan, depends how big you roll the dough.
You can use a glass saucer (plate) to cut the long roll into lengths to fit into the pan. Usually I get 3 'Legs' and a small one which I bake later on a cookie sheet.
DO NOT BAKE POTICA ON A COOKIE SHEET. It bakes better in the above suggested pans.
Let raise for 15 to 30 minutes ONLY.
Bake for 1 hour on middle rack.
Remove from oven to cooling rack and brush top with cold water. Cover with a towel for 1 hour.
Remove carefully from pan and separate the 'Legs' with care and let cool completely before wrapping for storage.
notes: It keeps 2 weeks in refrigerator, but about 6 months in the freezer if well wrapped. I wrap in saran wrap first and then foil. Also, newspaper over the foil keeps it much nicer. 'Legs' refers to your cut length of Potica.

title: Risotto
description: A creamy Italian rice dish.
instructions: In a medium sauce pan, combine 2 cans of chicken broth and about 1 1/2 tsp. of the tomato paste to start. Dissolve the paste in the broth and let this come to a boil, then reduce heat to keep warm.
Meanwhile, in a large heavy pan, on low heat, saute onion in butter, just until onion is turning clear. Then add Nutmeg.
Pour one handful of rice per person, and an extra handful for the pot (this recipe was made for 4 handfuls of rice).
With a wooden spoon, stir the rice, onions and butter until rice is slightly browned.
Pour enough broth over the rice so that the rice is covered by about 1" inch of broth. Stir and let simmer.
As the rice cooks down, keep adding broth until the rice is tender (about 20 to 30 minutes).
Serve immediately and sprinkle with Parmesan Cheese to taste.
notes: This dish goes great with chicken.

title: Risotto
description: Another version of the Italian rice dish.
instructions: Saute onion in oil or margarine about 5 minutes.
Add rice and continue cooking until rice is golden.
Add wine and boil about 1 minute.
Stir in half of chicken stock and continue stirring and adding stock as needed until rice is tender.
Add cheese.
notes: Mushrooms, peas, or broccoli may be added if desired. Serves about 4.

title: Saltimbocca
description: An Italian veal dish.
instructions: Salt veal very lightly.
Use one piece of salvia and one piece prosciutto in each veal cutlet.
Roll up, brown in butter.
Simmer slowly in oven.
At last, add dry wine.
notes: May also use ham or salami in place of prosciutto.

title: Sausage Stuffed Onions
description: Onions stuffed with a savory filling.
ingredients: 1 Real Large Onion (Chop up the onion that's left in the center for the filling)
1 Loaf of Bread Soaked in 1 Qt. of Milk
Chopped Onion (from center of Onion above)
Pepper & a Little Salt to Taste
instructions: Boil whole onion until tender.
Grease and line muffin tins.
Take onion apart and line each muffin tin with it.
Then you fill each cup with top filling then dot with butter and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until done when tested with toothpick.

title: Simple Spaghetti Sauce
description: A basic Italian tomato sauce for pasta.
ingredients: 1 Qt. or 1 Large Can Tomatoes - Chopped
instructions: Saute garlic in olive oil about 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and blend well.
Add parsley and basil, salt and pepper and cook uncovered over low heat about 1 hour. Stir occasionally.
Pour over cooked spaghetti and mix well.
Sprinkle with cheese.
notes: Serves 4. This is enough for about 1 pound of spaghetti.

title: Spinach Bread
description: A savory Italian bread filled with spinach.
instructions: Thaw and raise frozen bread dough and cut in half.
Roll one half of the bread dough to fit cookie sheet that has been lightly oiled.
Thaw the frozen spinach and fry in oil and garlic. Salt. Fry until very dry. Cool.
Spread on bread dough.
Add lots of grated Parmesan cheese, black olives and anchovies.
Roll other half of bread dough for top crust.
Seal edges and brush top with oil.
Bake at 350 Degrees for half an hour.
Cut into squares and serve either hot or cold.

title: Stuffed Zucchini
description: Zucchini boats filled with a cheesy mushroom mixture.
instructions: Cook zucchini in boiling salted water, covered, for 10-12 minutes.
Drain and cut in half lengthwise.
Scoop out center, leaving a 1/4 inch thick shell and chop the part you scoop out.
In skillet, melt butter and saute mushrooms.
Then stir in flour, salt and oregano. Remove from heat.
Stir in Jack cheese, sour cream and chopped zucchini.
Fill shells, using about 1/4 cup filling for each.
Top with Parmesan or Romano cheese.
Broil until hot and bubbly, three to five minutes.
notes: Real good - we love it! (I also put Romano cheese in filling)

title: Sugo
description: An Italian tomato-based sauce for pasta.
instructions: Saute garlic, onion and green pepper in olive oil.
Add tomato sauce, basil, parsley, bay leaf, salt, pepper and red pepper.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 1 hour.
Add tomato paste and your meatballs and sausage.
Let simmer for another 1 hour or so (depending on how much time you have until dinner).
Add red wine 20 minutes before serving.
Serve over your favorite pasta.
notes: Note: Retain juices from your browned meatballs and sausage and add this in with the olive oil, garlic, onions, and green pepper for better flavor.

title: Supremes
description: An Italian meat roll dish.
instructions: Pound the round steak and cut in small pieces, approximately 3 x 3.
Add salt and pepper, parsley, garlic, and a piece of salami.
Roll up and tie with string.
Brown and continue as with meatballs for sugo.

title: Tuna Fish Spaghetti
description: A quick and easy pasta dish with tuna.
ingredients: 2/3 Quart Tomatoes - Home Canned - Whole - Not Boiled Down
Celery - Leaves and All - Chopped Fine
instructions: Put oil in sauce pan and add garlic, brown, then discard garlic.
Add onion, brown very little.
Then throw in tomatoes, celery, salt & pepper, and nutmeg. Boil awhile.
Add tuna and anchovies and stir.
notes: This made enough for 5 people. Ma didn't use the tomato paste, but use your own judgment.

title: Typical Italian Salad
description: A simple, traditional Italian salad.
ingredients: 1/4 Green Pepper - Cut in Small Pieces
instructions: Rub garlic over sides of salad bowl.
Mix together oil, vinegar, salt and pepper.
Pour over vegetables and mix well.
notes: Serves 4.

title: Veal Scallopini
description: A classic Italian veal dish.
instructions: Flatten and flour veal lightly.
Use salt - no pepper.
Fry fast in butter on high heat.
When veal is cooked, add dash of marsala wine, simmer few minutes more.

title: Au Gratin Potatoes
description: A creamy, cheesy potato casserole.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Place in a 9x13 cake pan or casserole dish.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
notes: Add more cheese if desired.

title: Baked Beans
description: A hearty baked bean dish with hamburger.
instructions: Brown the hamburger and onion which you have seasoned with salt, pepper and garlic powder. Drain off the grease.
Add the brown sugar and ketchup and let simmer.
Place the beans in a crock pot and add the hamburger mixture. Stir together until mixed well.
Let cook in crock pot for a couple of hours or until ready to serve.

title: Broccoli Rice Casserole
description: A creamy broccoli and rice casserole.
instructions: Saute onion, broccoli and cheese in butter.
Then add remaining ingredients.
Bake in a 9 x 13 pan for 60 minutes at 325 degrees.

title: Calico Beans
description: A colorful bean dish with bacon and ground beef.
ingredients: 2 lbs. Ground Beef - Browned and Drained
2 lbs. Bacon - Cooked and Drained, Then Cut in Small Pieces
2 Cans Light Red Kidney Beans - Undrained
instructions: Saute the Onions and Green Peppers.
Put all ingredients in large roaster and bake for 1 hour at 350 Degrees.
notes: NOTE: This is a double recipe. Great for pot luck parties. To make in 2 quart crock pot, cut recipe in half. Drain butter and kidney beans. Cover and cook on low 4 to 9 hours.

title: Candied Yams
description: Sweet and nutty baked yams.
ingredients: 2 Large Cans Yams - Reserve 1/2 Cup Juice
instructions: Use a 9 x 12 Pan. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place yams in pan and add juice and margarine.
Sprinkle brown sugar over top and then walnut pieces on top of that.
Bake for 1 hour.

title: Crustless Cheddar-Spinach Pie
description: A cheesy spinach quiche without crust.
instructions: Cook and drain spinach (squeeze out water).
Toss cheese with flour.
Combine eggs, milk and seasonings.
Add cheese, egg mixture and spinach. Mix well.
Pour into greased 9 inch pie plate.
Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.
notes: This is good for lunch or breakfast. It's like a quiche.

title: Lemon Potatoes
description: Zesty lemon-flavored potatoes.
instructions: Place the potatoes in a heavy saucepan.
Add the lemon juice, butter, salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then simmer, covered, for 12-14 minutes.
Drain.
Sprinkle with lemon rind and parsley.
Serve hot.

title: Eggplant Casserole
description: A savory eggplant dish baked with bread crumbs and cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Peel eggplant and cook in boiling, lightly salted water, just until tender. Drain well and place in large mixing bowl; mash.
Stir in butter, onion, celery, basil, salt, pepper and half of bread crumbs.
Turn mixture into oiled or buttered casserole dish; top with remaining crumbs.
In small bowl, beat together egg and milk; pour over casserole.
Sprinkle top with grated Parmesan cheese and paprika.
Bake in preheated oven 30 minutes, until top is golden brown and casserole is heated through.
notes: Serves 4 to 6.

title: Spinach Squares
description: A simple spinach side dish or appetizer.
instructions: Cook spinach as directed and drain.
Mix together sour cream, onion soup and spinach and put in buttered dish.
Cover with bread crumbs and dot with butter.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1/2 hour.

title: Zucchini Pie
description: A sweet zucchini pie that tastes like apple pie.
ingredients: 4 Cups Zucchini - Peeled and Sliced Thin
instructions: Cover Zucchini with boiling water and let stand 5 minutes. Drain well.
Place in pie crust (unbaked).
Mix the brown sugar, granulated sugar, nutmeg, salt, and flour together and put on top of Zucchini.
Dot with butter and then sprinkle a mixture of the lemon juice and water over Zucchini.
Cover with top layer of pastry. Make slits on top.
Bake at 450 Degrees for 15 minutes, then 375 Degrees for 1 hour.

title: Apple Cake
description: A moist and delicious apple cake.
instructions: Cream shortening and sugar.
Add egg and vanilla.
Dissolve soda in hot water and put in the above mixture.
Add the flour, cinnamon, salt (optional), and nutmeg to the shortening mixture.
Then add the apples and nuts and mix all together.
Bake 45 minutes in 9 x 12 pan or other tin at 350 degrees.

title: Applesauce Raspberry Jello
description: A fruity jello dessert with a creamy topping.
instructions: Mix jello, boiling water, frozen raspberries, and applesauce.
Let stand overnight.
Next day, beat sour cream and marshmallows until peaks are formed.
Spread over Jello-fruit mixture.
Garnish with fruit on top.
notes: I usually just make the plain jello, but both are great!

title: Brownies
description: Rich chocolate brownies with a frosting.
instructions: In sauce pan bring to boil oleo, water and cocoa. Remove from heat and stir in sugar and flour until well mixed.
Add buttermilk, eggs, baking soda and vanilla. Mix well.
Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes in a greased and floured jelly roll pan.
For frosting: In a sauce pan bring the oleo, cocoa and milk to a boil. Remove from heat and add powdered sugar and vanilla.
Beat until reaches spreading consistency. Stir in walnuts.
Spread on warm brownies.

title: Butterhorns
description: Crescent-shaped pastries with a sweet filling.
ingredients: 1 Cake Compressed Yeast - or - 1 Package Dry Yeast
instructions: Mix yeast with warm water and 1 tsp. sugar. Set aside to rise.
Beat two egg whites until stiff, fold in 1/2 cup sugar, set aside.
Mix flour, salt and shortening and cut together as you would mix pie crust.
Add two well beaten egg yolks and the yeast mixture, kneading well with hands so yolks get evenly mixed.
Divide dough into four portions and roll like pie crust.
Spread each with egg white mixture, cinnamon and nuts.
Cut into eight pie-shaped pieces and roll into crescent shape.
Bake in ungreased pan 15 to 20 minutes at 350 degrees.
Remove from pan. When cool, frost with butter frosting, sprinkle with chopped pecans.
notes: Makes 32.

title: Carrot Cake
description: A moist carrot cake with cream cheese frosting.
instructions: Cream sugar and oil.
Add unbeaten eggs and cream until thick and pale in color.
Mix in flour, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon.
Fold in at the end the carrots and pecans.
Bake in a 9 x 13 pan for 30-35 minutes at 350 degrees.
Cool cake before frosting.
notes: Freezes nicely.

title: Cheese Cake
description: A classic cheesecake with graham cracker crust.
ingredients: 2 Cups Graham Crackers - Crushed (Use More if Needed)
instructions: Use a 'Spring Form' pan.
Mix together graham cracker crust ingredients until will hold shape in a ball. Then press firmly into pan bottom and sides.
Mix together cheese cake ingredients and beat at medium speed until smooth.
Pour cheese cake mixture into graham cracker crust and bake 35 minutes at 375 degrees.
Remove from oven. Increase oven heat to 475 degrees.
On top of baked cake, put the topping mixture. Spoon this on very carefully.
Put cake back in oven for 5 minutes.

After cake has cooled, spread on 1 can Wilderness cherry pie mix. Or, use fresh Strawberries, or a box of frozen strawberries, 1/2 Cup Sugar and 2 Tbsp. Cornstarch. Cook until thick. Cool slightly and spread on top of cheese cake.
Remove sides from spring form pan prior to serving.

title: Christmas Jello
description: A festive layered jello dessert.
instructions: Make cherry jello according to package directions. Put into 8 x 8 pan and refrigerate until set.
Stir together cream cheese and unwhipped cream until well blended.
Add pineapple and marshmallows.
Spread over jello.
Make lime jello and let set in separate bowl.
When lime jello has begun to set, pour over marshmallow layer.
