notes: One of our holiday favorites.

title: Dirt Dessert
description: A fun, kid-friendly dessert that looks like a flowerpot of dirt.
instructions: Crush cookies, break-up bars and blend together.
In medium bowl, cream butter, cream cheese and powdered sugar. Beat with mixer until smooth.
Combine pudding mix and milk and beat until it thickens.
Then fold in whipped topping and butter mixture. Blend well.
Place 1/3 of cookie mixture in bowl. Add some gummy worms and 1/2 of filling mixture.
Then add 1/3 of cookie mixture. Add rest of filling mixture and more gummy worms.
Top with remaining cookie mixture and cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Have some worms coming out of the 'dirt'.
notes: Cute when made in plastic flower pot, with some plastic flowers in and served with a garden hand spade (all new and clean, of course). Makes a lot.

title: Dump Bars
description: Easy to make layered dessert bars.
instructions: Melt margarine in 9" square cake pan.
Add graham cracker crumbs and pat evenly on bottom of pan.
Layer the remaining ingredients in the above listed order.
Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes.
notes: NOTE: This recipe can be doubled for cake pan size.

title: Ice Cream Pie
description: A simple, delicious ice cream dessert.
instructions: Mix peanut butter, corn syrup and Rice Krispies.
Butter glass pan and press mixture in as a crust.
Put in freezer to harden, let ice cream soften.
Fill crust with ice cream. Freeze overnight.
To serve, let soften and drizzle with caramel sauce.

title: No Egg Cookies
description: Crispy cookies made without eggs.
ingredients: 1 Cup Rice Krispies or Corn Flakes
1/4 Cup Hot Water with 1 tsp. Baking Soda
instructions: Mix in order given, then form into balls like a walnut and press with fork dipped in sugar like you do peanut butter cookies.
Put them on ungreased cookie sheet and bake in 350 degree oven for 8 to 10 minutes.

title: Orange Cake
description: A moist cake with orange flavor and raisins.
ingredients: 2 Oranges Squeezed and Save the Juice
instructions: Squeeze juice from oranges and set aside for frosting. Be sure to save orange peels and pulp for cake.
Grind orange peels and pulp together with the raisins.
Mix shortening and sugar.
Mix remaining dry ingredients together.
Alternate mixing dry ingredients and sour milk into sugar and shortening mixture.
Add vanilla and orange and raisin mixture.
Put into a greased and floured 9 x 13 cake pan and bake at 350 degrees for 45 - 50 minutes or until toothpick comes out clear.
Frost cake while warm.
Frosting: Use the juice you squeezed from the oranges and add about 1/4 cup sugar to the juice and pour over the hot cake.

title: Pecan Fingers
description: Delicate, nutty cookies rolled in powdered sugar.
instructions: Cream butter.
Add sugar, vanilla and water.
Next add flour, salt and nuts. Mix together.
Chill about 1 hour or more.
Form into small, finger size rolls.
Place on greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 250 degrees for 1 hour.
Roll in powdered sugar while still warm.

title: Special K Bars
description: No-bake cereal bars with peanut butter and chocolate.
ingredients: 1 Cup Creamy Peanut Butter (Not Low Fat!)
instructions: Over low heat combine sugar and syrup, bring to boil.
Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter.
Then add Special K cereal. Mix and then spread and press into a buttered 9 x 13" pan.
Let cool.
Melt chips together and spread over bars.
May refrigerate until firm and then should be stored at room temperature.

title: Tiramisu
description: A classic Italian coffee-flavored dessert.
ingredients: 1 (2 1/4 oz.) package sliced almonds, toasted (1/2 cup)
instructions: Combine cheese, sugar, whipping cream, rum and vanilla in large mixer bowl; beat until smooth and creamy.
Arrange 1 1/2 packages ladyfingers, cut side down, in bottom of 7 x 11-inch glass baking dish.
Pour half of coffee over ladyfingers.
Spread half of cheese mixture over ladyfingers.
Sprinkle half of nuts and half of cocoa over cheese.
Arrange remaining ladyfingers over cocoa; sprinkle with remaining coffee and layer with remaining cheese, nuts and cocoa.
Refrigerate, covered several hours or overnight.
To serve: garnish with cherries. Carefully scoop down through all layers/ serve in sherbet dishes or on dessert plates.
notes: * To substitute for brewed espresso, use 3 rounded teaspoons instant espresso and 1 cup boiling water.

title: Zucchini Jam
description: A unique jam made with zucchini that tastes like pineapple.
instructions: Boil zucchini and drain off any water. Boil till clear.
Add sugar, lemon juice, pineapple and orange. Cook slowly for 10 - 12 minutes.
Remove from heat. Add jello and orange juice. Mix well.
Pour into containers and cover.
Freeze or refrigerate.
notes: Makes 8 - 1 cup containers.
